column4: Does anyone have any ideas why my GRUB never auto loads the default? it just sits there until I press esc and select one
One sec santiago
I'm trying to find the right app
Santiago, in terminal type sudo -get install flashplugin-nonfree
sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
I swear I typed apt >.> lol
Anyone know why my GRUB never auto boots? It just sits saying Loading default in 2 (or however it says it) I have to press esc and select the kernal
it doesnt actually count down?
that's really weird, no idea actually
can you pastebin /boot/grub/menu.lst ?
what if you dont use hiddenmenu?
Um... do what? -D
put a # in front of 'hiddenmenu' :P
Do I need to like... sudo gedit menu.lst?
yes
If I put a # in front of that, won't it just get rid of the countdown all together?
nah, the countdown will stick, it just wont hide the boot menu
Alright, rebooting, brb
Now it just shows the kernal selector, along the bottom it says the highlited option will be booted in 3 seconds, but never counts down
that's.... weird
there is a bug submission for this on launchpad though: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/grub/+bug/288365
apparently, someone fixed it by replacing the battery on their motherboard... it could be the cause of your problem, I am not certain
